Package com.tozny.e3db.android

Android-specific E3DB functionality.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    KeyAuthenticator.AuthenticateHandler
    Receives the result of authenticating a user using their fingerprint or their lock screen PIN.
    KeyAuthenticator.PasswordHandler
    Receives the result of gathering a password from the user.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AndroidConfigStore
    Implements secure configuration storage.
    KeyAuthentication
    Determines how a key is protected when stored on the device.
    KeyAuthenticator
    Provides an interface for authenticating with the user, by gathering a password, asking for a fingerprint, or by entering a device PIN.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    KeyAuthentication.KeyAuthenticationType
    Specifies the type of key authentication mechanisms supported.

Package com.tozny.e3db.android Description

Android-specific E3DB functionality.

Secure Configuration Storage

The classes in this package support storage of E3DB credentials & configuration using the Android Key Store (when on API 23+), or using a secure filesystem based keystore.

You can use the AndroidConfigStore, in conjunction with the Config.loadConfigSecurely(com.tozny.e3db.ConfigStore, com.tozny.e3db.ConfigStore.LoadHandler)/ Config.saveConfigSecurely(com.tozny.e3db.ConfigStore, java.lang.String, com.tozny.e3db.ConfigStore.SaveHandler)/ Config.removeConfigSecurely(com.tozny.e3db.ConfigStore, com.tozny.e3db.ConfigStore.RemoveHandler) methods to manage E3DB credentials.

On API 16 - 23, we recommend storing E3DB configuration with a user-supplied password. On API 23 and above, we recommend protecting E3DB configuration with the user's lock screen PIN. We do not recommend passwords on API 23+ as that protection is not able to take advantage of the built-in Android Key Store.
